title: 112_hr5393
content: The "Export Coordination Act of 2012" may be cited as the short title. The Act outlines duties related to export coordination. The Export Enhancement Act of 1988 is amended to include identifying opportunities for office consolidation, coordinating electronic databases, and providing detailed listings of trade missions and fairs. The Secretary of Commerce will make information on trade missions and fairs available on Export.gov or a successor website. SEC. 3. STRATEGIC PLAN. Section 2312(c) of the Export Enhancement Act of 1988 is amended to include new requirements for export promotion and financing activities of agencies in the TPCC. This includes clearly identifying agency roles, describing goals and objectives, and explaining the rationale for measuring and reporting these goals. Additionally, there are amendments related to the President, Congress, and paragraph references. In paragraph (4), there are amendments to strike certain words. A new paragraph (7) is added to include recommendations from the Comptroller General regarding coordination within the TPCC. Additionally, in paragraph (7), the United States National Tourism Organization is replaced with the United States Travel Association. SEC. 4. MEMBERSHIP AND STAFF. The Export Enhancement Act of 1988 is amended to include the Millennium Challenge Corporation and representatives from State trade promotion agencies in the Trade Promotion Coordinating Committee. The Export Enhancement Act of 1988 is amended to allow Federal department or agency personnel to be detailed to the Trade Promotion Coordinating Committee upon request of the chairperson on a reimbursable basis. SEC. 5 amends the Export Enhancement Act of 1988 regarding member qualifications for the TPCC. SEC. 6 requires a report to Congress. Subsection (g) of section 2312 of the Export Enhancement Act of 1988 is amended to require the chairperson of the TPCC to submit an annual report to Congress by March 30. The report should detail the strategic plan, its implementation, revisions, funding for export promotion activities, and the interagency working groups on energy. The TPCC chairperson must submit an annual report to Congress by March 30, detailing the strategic plan, implementation, funding for export promotion activities, and interagency working groups on energy. The term 'appropriate congressional committees' is defined in subsection (g) of section 2312 of the Export Enhancement Act of 1988. SEC. 7. ADDITIONAL REPORT TO CONGRESS. Section 2312 of the Export Enhancement Act of 1988 is amended to require the Inspector General of the Department of Commerce to submit an annual report to Congress on the TPCC's performance and strategic plan implementation, consulting with other federal agencies' inspectors general. The TPCC member agency must report to Congress annually through the appropriate congressional committees as defined in subsection (g)(2).
